page.title: 11SCHOOLS
page.content: At the time of writing (June 1985) a new primary school is being built to replace a 19th century building in Pewsey and other smaller village schools for all children aged 5 - 11 years. Pewsey Vale School takes pupils from 11 -16 years. With about 550 pupils, it is one of the smallest viable comprehensive schools in the country, serving villages for 10 miles around. Academically and in sports Pewsey Vale can match its bigger neighbours, as well as having the advantages of a more intimate atmosphere in a smaller organisation. Pupils going on to further education attend school at Marlborough or colleges at Salisbury, Trowbridge or Swindon at 16 years.
